alert.note: Alert for Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 23 at 7:11AM CDT until September 23 at 8:15AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT FOR GREELEY...VALLEY...NORTHEASTERN SHERMAN AND NORTHERN HOWARD COUNTIES... At 710 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fort Hartsuff State Park to Sherman Reservoir Dam, moving east at 35 mph. Additional severe thunderstorms with large hail were located over central Greeley County, also moving east. HAZARD...Half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... Ord, Greeley, St. Paul, Spalding, Scotia, North Loup, Wolbach, Elba, Ashton, Farwell, Elyria, Cotesfield, Cushing, Fort Hartsuff State Park, and Sherman Reservoir Dam. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Hastings.
